intro: Erigeron bardsirica, commonly known as the Bardsir fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It features slender stems and small, white to pale blue ray flowers surrounding a central disk. Erigeron bardsirica is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils.
